Event_Name: Taking Charge of the Future: How trade unionists can lead economic debate
Event_Title: Taking Charge of the Future: How trade unionists can lead economic debate
consolidated_Data: seminar take place fórsa offices wed19 april 2023 15:30 - 16:30. also live streamed. details follows:title: 'taking charge future: trade unionists lead economic debate'speaker: michael taft, research officer, siptudate: wednesday 19 april 2023time: registration 15:15. lecture run 15:30 16:30.location: fórsa office, nerney's court, rotunda, dublin 1, d01 r2c5details seminar:michael taft, research officer siptu present 'taking charge future: trade unionists lead economic debate'. discuss irish rehn-meidner model. subsequently, discussion open floor chairperson present questions speaker.abstract: ireland long-term economic framework – policies lasted long time. enter period uncertainty overlapping crises (a ‘polycrisis’) need new, progressive long-term framework meet challenges. trade union movement driving agent.we look traditional swedish model inspiration. contrary popular view, swedish model based high-tax, high-spend policies. grounded economic framework (the rehn-meidner model) proposed swedish trade union movement early 1950s meet challenges full employment, price stability, income social equality, productivity. irish trade union movement propose ‘r-m model’ meet challenges future. compilation short-term policies address latest government failing, rather long-term restructuring democratisation productive base irish economy upon fiscal adequacy living standards dependent. challenge current orthodoxy even many traditional trade union analyses. way irish trade unionists ensure producers goods services (aka working class) privileged.biography presenter: michael taft research officer siptu author notes front, political economy blog. also member national competitiveness productivity council, low pay commission. business Ireland Events, Dublin City Events, Things to do in Dublin, Dublin Seminars, Dublin Business Seminars

Event_Name: Rob Heron & The Tea Pad Orchestra
Event_Title: Rob Heron & The Tea Pad Orchestra
consolidated_Data: rob heron & tea pad orchestra + louisiana 6 rob heron & tea pad orchestrarob heron & tea pad orchestra don’t care genre choose put – western swing, blues, country, rock & roll whatever else– long understand they’re 100% sincere 100% immersed stuff. lazy pastiche, dressing box. live breathe music want get immersed them.the tea pad ten years remarkable story began four friends studying newcastle university sees playing venues festivals across uk mainland europe. based newcastle upon tyne members hailing orkney warwickshire, tea pad sound draws myriad influences – hank williams django reinhardt, tom waits beatles – yet ultimately sounds like nobody else, north eastern swing style that’s utterly changing time.across four studio albums – 2012’s “money isn’t everything”, 2014’s “talk weather”, 2016’s “something blue” 2019’s “soul city” – band constantly added new flavours sound: heron particular vinyl obsessive, always fired new passion – calypso boogaloo whatever week brings – eclecticism feeds songs, newest releases adding twangy 60s guitar tones modernist r&b styles.the band tour way bands – widely endlessly – winning friends fans new show notable performances festivals like glastonbury, bestival, wilderness cambridge folk festival. they’ve appeared three times radio 4’s loose ends, music played everyone marc riley huey morgan.october 2022 see band release fifth studio album, “the party’s over”, takes signature blend classic country rhythm blues new level. decade honing craft, might best album date!joining rob heron (vocals/guitar) tom cronin (mandolin/harmonica/guitar), colin nicholson (accordion/organ/piano) ted harbot (double bass/electric bass) paul archibald (drums) music Ireland Events, Dublin City Events, Things to do in Dublin, Dublin Performances, Dublin Music Performances

Event_Name: M Stevens & The Ghasts single launch
Event_Title: M Stevens & The Ghasts single launch
consolidated_Data: stevens ghasts release go gracefully, third single album birds, launch party. stevens & ghasts announced release go gracefully, third single album birds, launch party accompanying video workman's cellar, dublin, april 6th, 2023. special guest night electro-pop wunderkind neosupervital. follow first two singles released late 2022 - purple heather garden - go gracefully contemplative offering, steeped singer songwriter tradition featuring unexpected lyrical detours stevens known. exploring themes catholicism, alienation spiritual paralysis, opens simple, finger-picked guitar working way towards grand emotional swell.reviews birds“birds exciting debut album lives experience pedigree talent onboard … (a) blend wit thoughtfulness …. wonderfully produced arranged” (the goo november 2022)“strings, flutes, mandolins music hall piano employed build deftly appointed musical worlds stevens populate drunk gods, alien ejaculate uv lit teeth” (totally dublin january 2023)“ … oscillates delicate driving keeping mordant wit tongue cheek … earnest yet wry album made heart can’t help charm” (the thin air, november 2022). neosupervital (aka tim o’donovan) released two albums date - ‘neosupervital’ (2006) ‘battery power’ (2010). third album, aptly titled ‘3’, arrives later year. features hallmark. neosupervital synths, beats, lyrics harmonies, whilst adding new spacious textures, wonky guitars laid back rhythms.as well fronting neosupervital, tim drummed irish bands bell x1, join pines keeley, one half electro pop duo buffalo woman.‘back what’ (2023 mix) latest nsv single. 3:11 pop tune getting back simpler things like walking, riding train, sitting step, important things nature. music Ireland Events, Dublin City Events, Things to do in Dublin, Dublin Performances, Dublin Music Performances, folk, indie, pop, dublin, folkmusic

Event_Name: Duncan Maitland plays the Alternative Sunday Social Club in The Wild Duck
Event_Title: Duncan Maitland plays the Alternative Sunday Social Club in The Wild Duck
consolidated_Data: duncan maitland launches new album gig alternative sunday social club wild duck originally stoke trent england, duncan maitland formed first band, flood, 1985. band dissolved, producer ronnie stone (the pixies, david gray mansun) suggested duncan replacement guitar player left irish band picture house. end 1993, duncan full-time member one band’s principal songwriters responsible two biggest hits, heavenly day sunburst. departed band duncan began playing acclaimed irish band pugwash also began recording material home enjoyed several successful solo gigs across country. 2001 saw duncan gigging solo pugwash, well playing second album, highly praised almanac secured first film soundtrack addition sunburst featured comedy, fertile man ireland. 2004 commenced work pugwash third studio album, playing alongside xtc’s dave gregory section quartet infamous abbey road studios. also found time compose soundtrack music film detained - gathered great reviews film music. beginning 2005 saw duncan returning song writing, co-penning song anchor xtc’s andy partridge pugwash’s thomas walsh time completion pugwash album, jollity. leading involvement, duncan asked contribute keyboards xtc song say band’s apple box release. also toured anny celsi nelson bragg, brian wilson band 2010 recorded first solo album lullabies 21st century, huge critical acclaim made many ‘best of’ end year top tens. past decade demand producer session musician, producing among others slumberjet, colin hare, gavin mee new upcoming album jack lukeman. duncan currently finishing new album leslie keye arad studios debuting new material alongside ‘golden oldies’ wild duck gig. “folks expect new stuff played first time, stuff lullabies 21st century maybe bits along way...it's going stripped back intimate affair way like it.” music Ireland Events, Dublin City Events, Things to do in Dublin, Dublin Performances, Dublin Music Performances

Event_Name: A conversation with Michel Déon Prize winner, François Cérésa
Event_Title: A conversation with Michel Déon Prize winner, François Cérésa
consolidated_Data: professor mary gallagher (ucd) conversation 2021 winner michel deón prize, françois cérésa. michel déon prize founded 2018 memory french writer michel déon (1919-2016) made west ireland home. joint prize awarded alternate years royal irish academy ireland (funded department foreign affairs) académie française france. winning author gets prize €10,000 honour visiting country deliver michel déon lecture following year. 2021 winner académie française prize mr. françois cérésa. conversation professor mary gallagher, mr. céréza explore emphasis oeuvre, also perspective experience writer. french writer member académie française, chantal thomas introduce françois cérésa.françois cérésa french writer journalist. author forty books, exploring less fertile lands french literature years. free constraints genre style, cérésa takes reader journey space time. goes historical novel, footsteps victor hugo duma, less disguised autobiography, via parodic tales even dishevelled picaresque epics.he also distinguished journalist, worked nouvel observateur, figaro, paris match. 2007, founded service littéraire, monthly magazine dedicated defence illustration french language demanding criticism current novels. journal, aims canard enchaîné literary criticism, distinguished freedom tone written exclusively writers.he received twelve literary prizes including michel déon prize académie française 2021.mary gallagher currently professor french francophone studies university college dublin. principal contribution field study (mass) mental domination, betrayal trauma register 20th- 21st-century writing french. published studies writings saint-john perse, edouard glissant, emmanuel levinas, colette fellous, annie ernaux, paul morand, dany laferrière, edwidge danticat, emile ollivier paul léon, amongst others. present working writing lafcadio hearn, colette, j.m.g. le clézio, marguerite duras karine tuil. chantal thomas french writer, screenwriter historian. taught literature number american universities author 20 books. 2002 prix femina novel farewell, queen (2004), also adapted film benoit jacquot. received roger-caillois prince pierre de monaco prizes entire work elected member académie française 2021. memories low tide, translated natasha lehrer, (pushkin press, 2020) latest book.this event jointly hosted royal irish academy french embassy ireland.-﻿-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------le grand prix michel déon été créé en 2018 en mémoire de l’écrivain et académicien michel déon (1919-2016). français, il choisi pour sa domicile l’ouest de l’irlande, une région historiquement liée à une des langues officielles de l’irlande, l’irlandais. ce prix est décerné en alternance par l’académie française et le royal irish academy (financé par le department foreign affairs, gouvernement d’irlande). le lauréat/la lauréate reçoit la somme de 10.000€ ainsi que l’honneur de faire le discours michel déon l’année suivante. en 2021, le prix était conféré à m. françois cérésa par l’académie française.françois céréza promet de parler de ‘la direction de ce j’écris’, au gré des questions de mary gallagher non seulement sur sa propre œuvre, mais aussi et plus généralement sur sa perspective et sur son expérience d’écrivain.m. cérésa sera présenté par l’écrivaine et académicienne française chantal thomas.françois cérésa est un écrivain et journaliste français. auteur d'une quarantaine de livres, il explore depuis des années les terres plus ou moins fertiles de la littérature française. libéré de toute contrainte de genre ou de style, cérésa entraîne son lecteur dans un voyage à travers l'espace et le temps. il va du roman historique, sur les traces de victor hugo ou de dumas, à l'autobiographie plus ou moins déguisée, en passant par les récits parodiques et jusqu'à l'épopée picaresque la plus échevelée.il est également un journaliste émérite, qui collaboré au nouvel observateur, au figaro et à paris match. en 2007, il fonde service littéraire, un mensuel dédié à la défense et à l'illustration de la langue française à travers une critique exigeante de l'actualité romanesque. la revue, qui se veut le canard enchaîné de la critique littéraire, se distingue par sa liberté de ton et est rédigée exclusivement par des écrivains.il reçu douze prix littéraires dont le prix michel déon de l'académie française en 2021.mary gallagher est enseignante depuis 1991 à university college dublin. elle est l’auteure de plusieurs ouvrages sur l’écriture antillaise, dont la créolité de saint-john perse (1998), soundings french caribbean writing since 1950 (2002), ici-là : place displacement caribbean writing french (2003). elle dirigé ou co-dirigé d’autres ouvrages sur des sujets plus vastes comme world writing: ethics, poetics, globalization (2008), la migrance à l’œuvre (2011) ou re-thinking ressentiment (2016). elle plus récemment étudié (en les traduisant en anglais) hiver caraïbe de paul morand (caribbean winter, signal books, 2018) et les lettres de drancy/compiègne de paul léon (dans james joyce paul l. léon: ‘the story friendship’ revisited (bloomsbury academic, 2022). chantal thomas est une écrivaine, scénariste et historienne française. elle enseigné la littérature dans plusieurs universités américaines et est l'auteure de plus de 20 romans. en 2002, elle remporté le prix femina pour son roman les adieux à la reine (2004), également adapté au cinéma par benoît jacquot. elle reçu le prix roger-caillois de littérature française et le prix prince pierre de monaco pour l'ensemble de son œuvre et été élue membre de l'académie française en 2021. souvenirs de la marée basse (memories low tide) est son dernier roman publié en anglais, traduit par natasha lehrer (pushkin presse, 2020).cet évènement est réalisé par le royal irish academy en collaboration avec l’ambassade de france en irlande. Event_Name: New Life for Old Buildings - Site Visit Series: Cloughjordan
Event_Title: New Life for Old Buildings - Site Visit Series: Cloughjordan
consolidated_Data: process bringing vacant property back use? event you! process bringing vacant property back use? join us april 1st cloughjordan view 200 year old stone house renovation project, meet people also undertaking labour love.this second three site-visits organised irish architecture foundation aimed sharing knowledge among bringing vacant properties back use. site visit hosted property owner undertaking project followed nearby cup tea chat. chance swap tips, woes (and joys!), learn other.this site visit cloughjordan, co. tipperary. building 3-storey stone terrace house two shops ground floor. previous unsympathetic renovations removed, modern features introduced including large open plan living/dining room. building works included full energy retrofit using healthy building principles, breathable materials renewable energy system including ashp mvhr.about host: architect caelan bristow renovating stone house (c.1800) cloughjordan co. tipperary since 2018. caelan studied london (the architectural association) los angeles (sciarc). worked paris, la, new york moving ireland 1999. initial 4 years solearth ecological architecture, established practice, based cloughjordan.established 2005, iaf independent organisation dedicated promotion architecture culture. encourage people engage built environment, inspire new ways thinking architecture.irish architecture foundation core funders: arts council ireland; department housing, local government & heritage; office public works. community

invited consider selection state records held archives – released 20-year rule – relating negotiation belfast agreement use documents reflect upon events atmosphere time significance shared history. panel bring different perspectives bear process agreement historian, diplomat, journalist artist, speak importance public record preserving collective memory.the event take place person proni (public head history qub. advised number public bodies historical commemorations 2020-21 member northern ireland office's centenary historical advisory panel. among extensive media commentary recently covered release 1997-98 state papers proni nai number media outlets including bbc, utv irish times.david donoghue spent total nearly 25 years working northern ireland, anglo-irish relations peace process. included several periods department’s anglo-irish division, posting irish embassy london four-year term (1995-9) irish joint secretary anglo-irish secretariat belfast. member irish government team negotiations delivered good friday agreement, published book (“one good day”, september 2022). amanda dunsmore works art processes explore representations societal transformation. contextual portraits Event_Name: EL ANEXO (Stand Up Comedy En Español)
Event_Title: EL ANEXO (Stand Up Comedy En Español)
consolidated_Data: christian meza tour por europe stand comedy en español tenemos el gusto de traerles uno de los mejores cómicos de méxico hasta tierras irlandesas, como parte de su tour europeo. claro que tenemos que visitar dublín.¡por primera vez en escenarios europeos! christian meza... el principe del barrio, con anécdotas del día día de las situaciones cotidianas en el trabajo, con la familia, con tu pareja amistades con un toque de humor propio único de el. su humor estilo al ser una persona humilde de barrio lo ha posicionado como uno de los mejores comediantes de mexico. una experiencia única llena de anécdotas para todo aquel hispanohablante que entiende el barrio.en sus viajes europa nos cuenta su experiencia de lo que es viajar como una persona de barrio que te hará reír sin parar. film and media Eventos en Irlanda, Eventos en Dublin City, Actividades en Dublín, Otro en Dublín, Otro de Cine y medios de comunicación en Dublín

Event_Name: Premiera filmului CARBON la DUBLIN, Irlanda
Event_Title: Premiera filmului CARBON la DUBLIN, Irlanda
consolidated_Data: cel mai de succes film moldovenesc vine la dublin! !!!s﻿old prima proiecție!!! bilete pentru proiecția nr. 2 de la dublin https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/a-doua-proiectie-a-filmului-carbon-la-dublin-irlanda-tickets-596199246997?aff=ebdshpsearchautocomplete!atenție! accesul la film se face doar pentru persoanele care au vârsta 18+. cei care nu îndeplinesc acest criteriu nu vor fi lăsați să intre. mulțumim pentru înțelegere.🙂 acțiunea filmului loc în moldova anului 1992, în nemijlocita apropiere de zonele „fierbinți” ale conflictului de pe nistru.carbon este povestea unui tânăr tractorist, dima, care, din simpla și naiva dorință de a-și construi viață „normală” alături de iubita sa, pornește pe un drum periculos, la capătul căruia așteaptă să-și vadă visurile împlinite.o descoperire sinistră transformă călătoria lui dima într-o aventură absurdă, plină de întorsături haioase și mai puțin haioase, situații penibile în care eroul se ciocnește de indiferența, goana după profit și prostia oamenilor care îl înconjoară. din toată această poveste, dima învață un lucru important –„să fie om!”, iar această descoperire îi schimbă viața!mai multe detalii despre echipa de creație filmului puteți găsi aici: http://carbonfilm.md/❗atenție: cinematograful este închiriat pe ore. de aceea filmul începe exact la ora stabilită și vă rugăm să veniți cu 30 minute înainte.filmul va fi subtitrat în engleză, de aceea puteți veni împreună cu prietenii voștri locali. vă așteptăm cu drag la carbon! film and media Ireland Events, Dublin City Events, Things to do in Dublin, Dublin Screenings, Dublin Film & Media Screenings, film, ireland, dublin, carbon, irlanda, moldova, dublin city events, dublin events

Event_Name: Смях по български в Арма
Event_Title: Смях по български в Арма
consolidated_Data: смях по български с жорони в арма, навръх международния ден на шегата хитовото стендъп комеди шоу "смях по български" на жорони, което обиколи европа през есента на 2022 ще гостува за първи път в град арма северна ирландия ☘😊след изключително успешното евро турне в германия, англия, дания, испания, австрия, ирландия и шотландия, нашумелият български стендъп комедиант георги николов - жорони се впуска в ново европейско приключение, като една от дестинациите е нашият град арма. българската публика ще има огромното удоволствие да се посмее на една изключителна комедия, в която всеки нашенец може да се припознае, без значение дали живее в пределите на родината, или отдавна е акустирал някъде зад граница. темите за семейството, любовта, сексът, децата, бащинството, професиите, традициите, тв форматите, киното, агресивният онлайн маркетинг, студентските бригади, пътуванията по света, спомените, куриозите и битът, са поднесени по един изключително забавен начин, без филтър и с изключително много самоирония и сарказъм. оградете датата 1 април с по-голямо кръгче,оставете задръжките си дълбоко скрити в някое чекмедже и елате да се посмеем...по български, както само ние си можем... ...вечерта ни ще продължи с dj music , забава и танци до зори 🎼🎧🕺🏻💃барът ще е отворен за свободна консумация🍺🍹🍸поради наличието на пикантен хумор в определени моменти, шоуто е с препоръчително възрастово ограничение - 14+оставяме изцяло на ваша преценка дали да доведете дете😇 film and media United Kingdom Events, Armagh City and District Events, Things to do in Armagh, Armagh Performances, Armagh Film & Media Performances, family, entertainment, comedy, comics

Event_Name: Ties that bind? Event with Graham Walker and James Greer
Event_Title: Ties that bind? Event with Graham Walker and James Greer
consolidated_Data: join us wednesday 5 april event celebrate launch ties bind? association irish academic press. ties bind? engrossing timely study historical, cultural political relationship scotland northern ireland seminal moment constitutional history places. seldom acknowledged, rarely explored real depth, important book conclusively demonstrates deeply entwined two countries are.the book explores scottish-ulster ties historically acted bridge britain ireland central contemporary debates regarding britishness, sectarianism devolution. reveals connections tensions ascendent scottish nationalism, brexit, deadlock northern ireland, argues that, rather inevitable collapse uk, challenges show constitutional futures scotland northern ireland still much grabs.graham walker emeritus professor political history queen's university belfast. published widely subject areas irish scottish history politics, politics sport.dr james greer's publications focused political history ulster unionism, modern troubles, british irish labour, irish presbyterianism. research also explored politics european integration northern ireland, literature popular culture twentieth-century northern ireland.guest speaker richard english professor politics queen's university belfast, also director senator george j. mitchell institute global peace, security justice. hobbies United Kingdom Events, Belfast Events, Things to do in Belfast, Belfast Appearances, Belfast Hobbies Appearances, politics, scotland, northernireland, books and authors, tiesthatbind

consolidated_Data: introductory lecture series ukraine's history culture students general public. aim lecture series, planned hilary term 2022, offer trinity students broader community overview ukraine’s eventful history well insights ukraine’s rich culture traditions. individual lectures reflect key episodes history ukraine, including formation kyivan rus’, expansion polish-lithuanian commonwealth, russian colonisation 18th 19th centuries, ukraine’s traumatic experience stalinism. series also introduce audience ukraine’s diverse literary scene, modern cultural intellectual traditions, ukrainian language question significance country’s jewish heritage.the series hopes equip students general public good, general understanding region – troubled past present.this event organised trinity’s department russian slavonic studies partnership du history society eastern european society. 1. ukraine histories – thursday, 9 february 6-7 pm, uí chadhain theatre2. history culture ukraine 19th century – thursday, 16 february 6-7 pm, robert emmet theatre3. ukraine’s jewish heritage – thursday, 23 february 6-7pm, thomas davis theatre 4. ukraine soviet union – thursday, 2 march 6-7 pm, thomas davis theatre5. ukrainian culture 20th century – thursday 16 march 6-7 pm, thomas davis theatre6. language ukraine – thursday, 23 march 6-7 pm, thomas davis theatre7. empire, nation, revolution: state society ukraine 1980s-2021 – thursday, 30 march 6-7 pm, jm synge theatre8﻿. tradition subversion: (re)inscribing ukrainian modernisms european canons - thursday, 6 april 6-7 pm, thomas davis theatre9﻿. grassroots ukrainianization: language popularization initiatives ukraine since 2014 - thursday, 13 april 6-7 pm, thomas davis theatref﻿or information contact: aporb@tcd.ie performing and visual arts Ireland Events, Dublin City Events, Things to do in Dublin, Dublin Seminars, Dublin Other Seminars, ukraine, ukrainehistory, ukraineculture

inside epic legal battle determine owns dna (ny:hachette/algonquin, 2021).k﻿ey note lecture: civil rights case gene patents america 2013, us supreme court held naturally occurring genetic sequences may patented, instantly invalidating thousands existing patent claims opening market genetic screens cancer hereditary diseases. case, association molecular pathology v. myriad genetics, remarkable many ways, least litigated civil rights case rather technical patent case. american civil liberties union public patent foundation, brought case 2009, represented group twenty plaintiffs -- researchers, professional associations, medical practitioners individual patients – arguing human genes, even isolated human body purified laboratory, constituted “products nature” ineligible patent protection. yet case hinged technical legal argument, host underlying policy considerations ranging access healthcare self-knowledge freedom thought. case progressed courts, attracted significant contreras:jorge contreras james t. jensen endowed professor transactional law director program intellectual property technology law university utah s.j. quinney college law, secondary appointment department human genetics, university utah school medicine. 2023 serving visiting fellow london school economics political science. professor contreras’s research focuses intellectual property, translational science (ncats) national advisory council human genome research (nachgr), co-chair national conference lawyers scientists. one co-founders open covid pledge, framework contributing battle determine owns dna (ny: hachette/algonquin, 2021), received praise outlets new york times wall st. journal nature stat, describes landmark civil rights litigation ended gene patenting america. graduate harvard law school (jd) rice university (bsee, ba), elected member american law institute. science and tech Ireland Events, Kildare Events, Things to do in Maynooth, Maynooth Seminars, Event_Name: Keynote Address - Income Inequality in Africa
Event_Title: Keynote Address - Income Inequality in Africa
consolidated_Data: evening keynote address dsai delighted host professor howard stein iveagh house, headquarters department foreign affairs. evening opened representative irish aid, moderated dr david nyaluke, vice-chair african scholars association dsai business development study group convenor. abstract:the trajectory development sub-saharan africa remains puzzling mainstream economists. poverty stays stubbornly high, growth uneven, life expectancy continued lag relative regions, despite governments adopting policies inspired neoclassical economics. economists used host extraneous explanations called “africa’s tragedy,” including ethnicity, geography, colonial history, legacy slave trade, poor governance, poorly developed social capital, things.this talk provides critical review mainstream understanding inequality africa illustrates policies arising standard economics exacerbated conditions. argue effort understand income inequality needs transcend neoclassical economics focus evolution institutions, related economic structures, way africa integrated global economy, determine current historical patterns.. discuss institutional approach income distribution explore patterns observed sub-saharan africa lens.about contributors:keynote speaker - howard stein professor department afroamerican african studies (daas) dept. epidemiology university michigan. development economist educated canada, us uk. also published dozen books edited collections 100 journal articles, book chapters reviews. held various academic appointments university dar es salaam, tanzania: hitotsubashi university, japan, sussex university; uk, university lisbon, portugal; university leiden, netherlands. undertaken research variety african countries foreign aid, finance banking, neoliberalism, methodology randomized controlled trials, health gender, climate change, industrial policy, export processing zones, agricultural policy, african overpayment sovereign bond issues, poverty rural property right transformation, income inequality, chinese economic relations institutionalization neoclassical economics.moderator - dr david nyaluke vice-chairperson african scholars association ireland, ucd proudly made africa fellow business development convenor dsai business development study group. researches teaches 'doing business africa' sustainable development across 15 business schools departments business universities, colleges institutes technology ireland. david's current research within area africa international trade system. research questions focus international trade system reformed various sectors foster sustainable development africa globally. joining ucd college business proudly made africa, david completed phd dublin city university (dcu). doctoral thesis investigated trajectories political economic development transformation african states independence 21st century. other Ireland Events, Dublin City Events, Things to do in Dublin, Dublin Seminars, Dublin Other Seminars
